| Years Ended December 31, | 
--- | --- | ---
 | 2019 | 2018
Sales | $  — | $  —
Cost of sales | (901) | (88)
Total operating expense | 1,022 | 96
Operating income (loss) from discontinued operations | (121) | (8)
Other income (expense) | 10,895 | (24)
Income (loss) from discontinued operations before income taxes | 10,774 | (32)
Provision (benefit) for income taxes | 2,294 | 6
Income (loss) from discontinued operations, net of income taxes | $8,480 | $(38)

paragraph 1: Discontinued Operations
paragraph 2: In December 2015, we completed the wind down of engineering, manufacturing and sales of our solar inverter product line (the "inverter business"). Accordingly, the results of our inverter business have been reflected as “Income (loss) from discontinued operations, net of income taxes” on our Consolidated Statements of Operations for all periods presented herein.
paragraph 3: The effect of our sales of extended inverter warranties to our customers continues to be reflected in deferred revenue in our Consolidated Balance Sheets. Deferred revenue for extended inverter warranties and the associated costs of warranty service will be reflected in Sales and Cost of goods sold, respectively, from continuing operations in future periods in our Consolidated Statement of Operations, as the deferred revenue, is earned and the associated services are rendered. Extended warranties related to the inverter product line are no longer offered.
paragraph 4: ADVANCED ENERGY INDUSTRIES, INC. NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS – (continued) (in thousands, except per share amounts)
paragraph 5: The significant items included in "Income (loss) from discontinued operations, net of income taxes" are as follows:

qa.question: What was the change in Provision (benefit) for income taxes between 2018 and 2019?

m.03c40gm_3.Answer Analysis: The answer is a numerical value, 2288, which represents the change in the provision for income taxes between 2018 and 2019.
m.03c40gm_3.Document Content Analysis: The document provides information about a Voluntary Employee Beneficiary Association (VEBA), which is a type of trust fund in the United States. It details the types of benefits a VEBA can provide, such as accident insurance, childcare costs, and life insurance, and specifies what it cannot provide, like commuter benefits and retiree income. It also mentions tax-deductible employer contributions and the requirements for beneficiaries.
